titleStmt.title: An exposition vpon the Lords Prayer, compared with the Decalogue as it was preached in a sermon, at Oatelands: before the most noble, Henry Prince of Wales. Aug. 13. Anno 1603. VVith a postscript, to advertise of an error in all those that leaue out the conclusion of the Lords Prayer. Also, the Creed is annexed, vvith a short and plaine explication of the article, commonly called: He descended to hell. By Hugh Broughton.
titleStmt.author: Broughton, Hugh, 1549-1612.

titleStmt.title: An exposition vpon the Lords Prayer, compared with the Decalogue as it was preached in a sermon, at Oatelands: before the most noble, Henry Prince of Wales. Aug. 13. Anno 1603. VVith a postscript, to advertise of an error in all those that leaue out the conclusion of the Lords Prayer. Also, the Creed is annexed, vvith a short and plaine explication of the article, commonly called: He descended to hell. By Hugh Broughton.
titleStmt.author: Broughton, Hugh, 1549-1612.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication conjectured by STC.
"Probably printed at Layden at the Pilgrim Press or in Aberdeen by Edward Raban."--Folger Shakespeare Library Catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
